text:
I'm a graphics reporter-in-training from Hanoi, Vietnam, currently entering senior year at New York University, where I study data science and journalism.

I recently finished an internship at [CoinDesk](https://www.coindesk.com/), where I spent three months [creating graphics](https://www.coindesk.com/where-fatf-crypto-compliance-gets-interesting-africa) for reporters and helping engineers integrate D3 and Datawrapper into their CMS. Before that, I was automating audience dashboards with D3 for [Pushkin Industries](https://pushkin.fm/), a podcast-production company founded by Malcolm Gladwell and Jacob Weisberg, as their first intern ever!

When I'm not working, I usually test new JavaScript libraries and polish my visualization skills on [Observable](https://observablehq.com/@duynguyen1678). *Real* hobbies, you ask? Riding a CitiBike along the Hudson, Bill Evans in my ears. Shake Shack and [*bún chả*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bun_cha). And, if I'm in Hanoi, embarassing my high-school [teammates](https://urbanisthanoi.com/hanoi-culture/16559-field-of-dreams-the-history-and-future-of-baseball-in-vietnam) with my subpar performance as a shortstop.

In the coming years, I hope to build the first data-visualization studio in Vietnam. I'll devote every tip, every piece of tech I'll have learned from friends and colleagues over the world to help Vietnamese newsrooms and businesses tell their stories.
